title: PICTURED: Jeremy Clarkson spotted with new girlfriend

organizations.name: hurling polo association polo players party

text:
Jeremy Clarkson has been pictured with his stunning new girlfriend on the Caribbean island of Barbados.
The 56-year-old petrolhead gazed adoringly at Lisa Hogan, 46, as they were collected by a luxury Mercedes outside Barbados's Grantley Adams International Airport ready to be whisked to Andrew Lloyd Webber's Sandy Lane Estate mansion.
The 6ft 2in blonde beauty wore a smart white blazer and shirt with loose-fitting trousers and white trainers for the long haul flight.
Scroll down for video
The look of love: Jeremy Clarkson has been pictured with his stunning new girlfriend Lisa Hogan on the Caribbean island of Barbados
Her luscious locks blew in the breeze as she went to enter the car closely followed by Jeremy.
The Grand Tour host wore a beige jacket and jeans, and carried a satchel over his shoulder.
The pair had plenty of luggage with them ready for a lengthy relaxing stay on the sun-soaked island.
Jeremy was very much in holiday mode, holding a bottle of beer as the chauffeur loaded up the car.
Relaxed: Jeremy was very much in holiday mode, holding a bottle of beer as the chauffeur loaded up the car
The pair, who have been seen together three times in the last few months, are staying in the island as guests of the English impresario Lord Webber.
Lisa is an Irish-born mother-of-three who is the ex-wife of a playboy known as Baron Bonkers.
A passer-by told The Sunday Mirror , which reported they were dating: 'Jeremy looked very relaxed around Lisa, and they seemed very taken with each other.
New chapter: Lisa is an Irish-born mother-of-three who is the ex-wife of a playboy known as Baron Bonkers
Helping hand: The 6ft 2in beauty was 'discovered' by John Cleese in the early 1990s when she was struggling to get a second-hand-clothes business off the ground
'They were laughing and joking around like a new couple.'
Hogan separated from Baron Steven Bentinck in 2005 after they had three children together.
The couple had previously divided their time between an apartment in Norris Castle on the Isle of Wight and the Baron's chalet in the Swiss ski resort of Klosters.
Lisa was 'discovered' by John Cleese in the early 1990s when she was struggling to get a second-hand-clothes business off the ground.
Over: Hogan separated from Baron Steven Bentinck (left) in 2005 after they had three children together
Glamorous: Hogan at the The Hurling Polo Association Polo Players Party (left) in 2006 and with Lance Gerrard-Wright in 2005 (right) who once appeared on a dating show 'Mr. Right'
He subsequently employed her as a researcher, became a close friend and even gave her a role in Fierce Creatures, his follow-up to A Fish Called Wanda.
Despite reports to the contrary, they were never romantically involved.
Hogan was once involved in an accident in a Learjet in which she narrowly escaped with her life.
Lucky escape: Hogan was once involved in an accident in a Learjet in which she narrowly escaped with her life. Pictured: Wreckage of the plane on the A40
Moving on: Clarkson, who co-presents Amazon's The Grand Tour with James May and Richard Hammond, was divorced from his wife, Frances, in 2014, following 21 years of marriage
She was on her way to film at Pinewood Studios in 1996 when the plane - chartered by Bentinck - overshot the runway at RAF Northolt and crashed onto the A40.
The aircraft then collided with a van, but Hogan amazingly escaped with just a cut on her leg.
Clarkson was divorced from his wife, Frances, in 2014, following 21 years of marriage.
